Message.Issue: Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Library_dtr.SendMessage(IntPtr, int, IntPtr, IntPtr)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Change the accessibility of P/Invoke 'Library_dtr.SendMessage(IntPtr, int, IntPtr, IntPtr)' so that it is no longer visible from outside its assembly.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'RecordStudent.DefWndProc(ref Message)' could contain the following variables 'this.templateString', 'this.studentIdNumber'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'RecordStudent.searchStudent_Click(object, EventArgs)' could contain the following variables 'this.studentIdField.Text'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'RecordStudent.SendMessage(IntPtr, int, IntPtr, IntPtr)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Change the accessibility of P/Invoke 'RecordStudent.SendMessage(IntPtr, int, IntPtr, IntPtr)' so that it is no longer visible from outside its assembly.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'FileStream' can be disposed more than once in method 'BitmapFormat.WriteBitmap(byte[], int, int)'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 294

Implement IDisposable on 'Database' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'MySqlConnection'. If 'Database' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 294

Rule.Name: Move P/Invokes to NativeMethods class
Rule.Description: This type contains members with the DllImport attribute. Members with the DllImport attribute should be contained in classes named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Rule.Resolution: Because it is a P/Invoke method, {0} should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.

Rule.Name: P/Invokes should not be visible
Rule.Description: Interop layer should not be public. The DllImport attribute should not be applied to publicly accessible members (public or protected).
Rule.Resolution: Change the accessibility of P/Invoke {0} so that it is no longer visible from outside its assembly.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
